meanings.definition: A person who looks after someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The minders at the daycare ensure the children are safe and happy.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper is the minder of the animals in the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The minders at the pet hotel make sure the dogs have a 'paw'some time.
meanings.sent4: She acted as a minder for her younger siblings during the family picnic.
meanings.sent5: The minder of the garden diligently waters the plants every morning.

meanings.definition: A person who is responsible for a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is the minder of the students during the field trip.
meanings.sent2: The camp counselor is a dedicated minder of the young campers.
meanings.sent3: The minder of the hiking group ensured everyone had enough snacks for the trail.
meanings.sent4: As the team captain, she was the minder of her soccer teammates' morale.
meanings.sent5: The minder of the tour group guided them through the museum with expertise.

meanings.definition: A device or system that alerts someone to a particular event or situation.
meanings.sent1: The alarm clock is a helpful minder to wake you up in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The smoke detector acts as a minder in case of a fire emergency.
meanings.sent3: The minder on her phone reminded her to drink water every hour.
meanings.sent4: The weather app serves as a minder for upcoming storms in the area.
meanings.sent5: The security system is a reliable minder for protecting the house from intruders.
